newsitem.title: ITALY: Heineken sells brewery to get Moretti deal.
newsitem.headline: Heineken sells brewery to get Moretti deal.

text.p: Dutch brewer Heineken NV said on Tuesday it is to sell an Italian brewery in order to get the official approval from Italy's anti-trust authority for its takeover of Italian brewer Moretti announced last year.

A Heineken statement said that it was to sell the brewery of San Giorgio di Nogaro in the northeast Italian city of Udine and also the brand Castello di Udine. The brewery accounts for five percent of Italian national beer production.
The purchaser of the brewery is industrial group Sitem with the backing of a group of banks. No financial details were given.

Italy's anti-trust authority gave its approval to the Heineken-Moretti deal last July if the combined group would cut its share of national beer production by five percentage points.. Heineken had announced the deal in February that year to buy Moretti from Interbrew, the Belgian brewer of Stella Artois.

The deal would have given Heineken a leading 40 percent share of the Italian beer market, but the brewery sale will bring its market share into line with Birra Peroni Industriale, in which French group Groupe Danone -- brewer of Kronenbourg -- has a minority stake.
